grandstand.translation[0].definitions[0]: a large structure that has many rows of seats where people sit and watch sports competitions, games, or races
grandstand.translation[1].definitions[0]: a sports programme that used to be broadcast on British television on Saturday and Sunday afternoons until 2007. It showed many different sports and at the end of the programme, the football and rugby results were read out. Its most famous presenters were Desmond Lynam and David Coleman.
